Package viewmodel.customNodes

Class GameplayInfoPane

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • javafx.scene.layout.VBox
              • viewmodel.customNodes.GameplayInfoPane
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
    public class GameplayInfoPane
extends javafx.scene.layout.VBox
    Displays info about the current level being played by the user.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameplayInfoPane

        public GameplayInfoPane​(javafx.beans.property.StringProperty levelNameProperty,
                        javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty timerProperty,
                        javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty numMovesProperty,
                        javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty numRestartsProperty)
        Parameters:
        levelNameProperty - the StringProperty which holds the current level name
        timerProperty - the IntegerProperty which holds the number of seconds the current level has been active since the most recent start/restart
        numMovesProperty - the IntegerProperty which holds the number of moves the user's Sokoban character has made on the map
        numRestartsProperty - the IntegerProperty which tracks how many times the user has restarted the current level

    • Method Detail

      • format

        private static java.lang.String format​(int s)
        Parameters:
        s - Seconds duration
        Returns:
        A string that formats the duration stopwatch style

      • bindTo

        private void bindTo​(javafx.beans.property.StringProperty levelNameProperty,
                    javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty timerProperty,
                    javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty numMovesProperty,
                    javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty numRestartsProperty)
        This function binds the text properties of the labels to the properties passed as parameters.

        Hint: Labeled.textProperty(), Bindings.createStringBinding(Callable, Observable...) are required. Follow the following format examples inside the square brackets:

        levelNameLabel: [Level: 1.txt] timerLabel: [Time: 00:01] numMovesLabel: [Moves: 1] numRestartsLabel: [Restarts: 0]

        Parameters:
        levelNameProperty - the StringProperty which holds the current level name
        timerProperty - the IntegerProperty which holds the number of seconds the current level has been active since the most recent start/restart
        numMovesProperty - the IntegerProperty which holds the number of moves the user's Sokoban character has made on the map
        numRestartsProperty - the IntegerProperty which tracks how many times the user has restarted the current level
